entry.title: Re: When will Crystal Reports implement SVG?
entry.content:
Yes, if you need to use SVG images in Crystal Reports, the 'Graphic Location' property can leverage a UFL to on-the-fly convert (as well as resize, crop, etc.) the SVG to an acceptable format.

But if what you need is native support, that doesn't seem to be part of SAP's vision (or lack thereof).

entry.title: The Ultimate SAP S/4HANA Guide: From Master Data to End-to-End Processes
entry.content:
The Ultimate SAP S/4HANA Guide: From Master Data to End-to-End Processes

Welcome to your all-in-one guide to SAP S/4HANA! Whether you're a complete beginner (a "dummy"), an end-user, a knowledgeable key user, or a seasoned consultant, this document is designed for you. We'll journey from the foundational building blocks of the system—master data—all the way through complex, real-world business processes.

Our guide is built around a fictional company, Global Tech Inc., a manufacturer and service provider of high-tech equipment. By following their journey, you'll gain practical, hands-on experience. We'll focus on modern SAP Fiori apps where possible and refer to the classic SAP GUI for other functions.

Part 1: The SAP S/4HANA Universe - An Introduction

Chapter 1: What is SAP S/4HANA? (The 5-Minute Briefing)

For the Absolute Beginner:

Imagine a huge company like Global Tech Inc. It has departments for buying parts (Purchasing), making products (Production), selling them (Sales), managing money (Finance), and taking care of employees (HR). In the old days, each department might have had its own separate computer system. This was messy—Sales wouldn't know what Production was doing, and Finance had to chase everyone for numbers.

An ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) system, like SAP S/4HANA, is a single, giant, integrated software that runs the entire company. It's like the company's central brain. All departments use the same system, looking at the same information in real-time. When the sales team sells a product, the warehouse team is instantly notified to ship it, the production team sees that they need to make more, and the finance team sees the revenue coming in.

What's special about S/4HANA? It's the latest generation from SAP. The "HANA" part means it runs on a super-fast, in-memory database. Think of it as upgrading your computer from a clunky old hard drive to a lightning-fast solid-state drive. This speed allows for real-time analytics and a much simpler data structure.

Fiori vs. GUI - Your Window into SAP:

You'll interact with SAP through one of two main interfaces:

SAP Fiori Launchpad: This is the modern, web-based, user-friendly interface. It's role-based, meaning you only see the apps ("tiles") you need for your job. It's designed to be simple and work on any device—desktop, tablet, or phone. We will prioritize Fiori apps in this guide. 2. SAP GUI (Graphical User Interface): This is the classic, "old-school" interface. While Fiori is the future, many powerful functions and configuration tasks still happen in the GUI. We'll use it when a Fiori app isn't available. You access functions in the GUI using Transaction Codes (T-Codes), which are like shortcuts (e.g., MM01 for Create Material).

Part 2: The Foundation - Core Master Data Setup

Master data is the bedrock of your SAP system. It's the core information about your business objects that doesn't change very often. You can't sell a product that doesn't exist in the system, and you can't pay an employee who hasn't been hired. Getting master data right is critical.

Chapter 2: The Human Element - Managing Employees (HCM)

Before any work can be done at Global Tech Inc., people need to be hired. In SAP, an employee is a central master data object. We'll first hire a general employee and then grant them additional roles, like making them a Sales Representative.

2.1. Creating a New Employee

The Big Picture:

Hiring an employee in SAP isn't just about adding a name to a list. It involves a "Personnel Action" that captures all necessary information: personal details, organizational assignment (what department they work in), payroll information, and more. This ensures the employee is correctly placed in the company structure and can be paid.

Step-by-Step Instructions (How-To):

This process is typically performed by an HR Administrator.

Access the Personnel Actions App:

Fiori App: Run Personnel Actions

SAP GUI: Transaction Code PA40

Start the Hiring Action: On the initial screen, you'll define the employee and the action.

From: Enter the employee's start date (e.g., today's date)1. This is crucial as it determines when the employee becomes active in the system.

Personnel no.: Leave this blank if the system is configured to assign an employee number automatically (internal number range). If your company uses external numbers, enter the unique employee number here (e.g.,

999001)2.

Action Type: Select "Hiring Service Provider" or a similar "Hiring" action from the list3.

Press

Execute to begin the guided hiring process4.

Complete the "Actions" Infotype (0000): An "infotype" is just an SAP term for a screen that groups related data.

Position: If your company uses Organizational Management, select the specific position the employee will fill (e.g., "Accountant")5.

Personnel Area: Enter your company's code for this location (e.g., 1000 for the Walldorf Head Office)6.

Employee Group: Select 1 (Active)7.

Employee Subgroup: Select Y1 (Salaried employees)8.

Click Save. The system will guide you to the next required infotype.

Complete Organizational Assignment (Infotype 0001):

Cost Center: Enter the cost center this employee's salary will be charged to (e.g., 1101 for the Finance Department)9. This is a key integration point with Finance.

Payroll Area: Select the appropriate payroll group (e.g., YB for monthly salaried staff)10.

Click Save.

Complete Personal Data (Infotype 0002):

Enter the employee's

Last Name, First Name, Birth Date, Nationality, etc.11.

Click Save.

Complete Other Infotypes: The system will prompt you to complete several other infotypes, such as Planned Working Time (Infotype 0007) and Travel Privileges (Infotype 0017)12. Fill in the required details and save each screen.

Result: You've successfully created a new employee in the system! You will receive a confirmation message with the new employee's personnel number.

2.2. Making an Employee a Sales Representative

The Big Picture:

Now, let's say we hired a new employee, Jane Doe, with personnel number 999301. She is moving into a sales role. We don't need to create a new person; we simply extend her existing employee master record with a new "view" containing sales-specific data. This links her as an employee to the Sales and Distribution (SD) module.

Step-by-Step Instructions (How-To):

This might be done by an HR Admin or a Sales Support Specialist.

Access the Maintain HR Master Data App:

Fiori App: Maintain HR Master Data

SAP GUI: Transaction Code PA30

Select the Employee and Infotype:

Personnel no.: Enter the number of the employee you just created (e.g., 999301)13.

In the "Direct selection" section, enter Infotype number

0900 (Sales Data)14.

Click the

Create icon (the blank page)15.

Enter Sales Data: On the "Create Sales Data" screen, you will link the employee to the sales structure.

Start Date: This defaults to today's date. Keep it as is16.

Sales Organization: Enter the relevant sales org (e.g., 1000)17. This is the primary organizational unit for sales.

Sales Office: Enter the physical sales office they belong to (e.g., 100)18.

Sales Group: Enter the specific team within that office (e.g., 100)19.

Click Save.

Result: Jane Doe is now recognized by the system as a Sales Representative. When a sales order is created in the sales area 1000 / 100 / 100, she can be assigned as the responsible employee. This is a perfect example of how SAP integrates different business functions.

For Consultants: Key Customizing & Technical Notes

Personnel Actions (PA40): The sequence of infotypes presented during the hiring action is configured in SPRO under: Personnel Management -> Personnel Administration -> Customizing Procedures -> Actions -> Define Infogroup. Each action (Hiring, Termination, etc.) has a defined infogroup.

Number Ranges: Employee number ranges are maintained in SPRO via transaction PA04. You define whether the assignment is internal (system-assigned) or external (user-assigned).

Infotype 0900: This infotype (PA0900) is the direct link between the HR object (Person) and the SD Partner Function object. It allows an employee to be used in sales documents.

Chapter 3: The Financial Framework (FI/CO)

Before we can post any financial transactions, we need a solid framework. This involves setting up structures that help us classify and report on costs and revenues accurately. One such structure is the Functional Area, which is essential for a type of accounting called Cost of Sales Accounting.

3.1. Understanding and Maintaining Functional Areas

The Big Picture:

Imagine you want to create a Profit and Loss (P&L) statement. You could structure it by the nature of the cost (e.g., salaries, rent, supplies). This is the traditional approach.

Cost of Sales Accounting structures the P&L by purpose or function within the company. For example:

Production Costs

Sales & Marketing Costs

Administration Costs

Research & Development Costs

The "Functional Area" is the SAP object that represents these functions. By assigning costs to functional areas, you can automatically generate a P&L statement in this format. The system can derive the functional area from various sources, such as the G/L account or the cost center being posted to20.

Step-by-Step Instructions (How-To):

This is a task for a Financial Accountant or Controller.

Part A: Assigning Functional Area in G/L Account Master Data

You should only do this for P&L accounts where the function is always the same. For example, a "Manufacturing Salaries" account should always be posted to the "Production" functional area.

Access the G/L Account Mass Maintenance App:

Fiori App: Manage G/L Account Master Data (and edit individual accounts) or use the mass change GUI transaction.

SAP GUI: Transaction Code OB_GLACC11

Select Accounts: On the initial screen, specify the Chart of Accounts and the range of G/L accounts you wish to edit21. Click

Execute.

Perform Mass Change:

You will see a list of the G/L accounts you selected.

Enter the appropriate Functional Area for each account (e.g., YB10 for Production, YB40 for Sales).

To apply a change to multiple accounts, select the rows, click the

"Carry out a mass change" button22.

Select the "Functional Area" field, enter the new value, and execute the change.

Click Save. The system will update all the selected G/L accounts.

Part B: Assigning Functional Area in Cost Center Master Data

This is the more common and flexible method. All costs posted to a specific cost center (e.g., the "Marketing Department" cost center) will inherit that cost center's functional area.

Access the Change Cost Center App:

Fiori App: Manage Cost Centers

SAP GUI: Transaction Code KS02

Select Cost Center: On the initial screen, enter the Cost Center you want to change (e.g., 1701) and press Enter or click Master Data2323.

Update Basic Data:

Go to the Basic Screen tab.

Find the

Functional Area field and enter the appropriate value (e.g., YB40 for a sales/marketing cost center)24.

If you change a functional area where postings already exist, the system may issue a warning. Be cautious, as this change only affects

future postings25.

Click Save.

Result: You have now structured your financial master data to support Cost of Sales accounting. When a user posts an expense to cost center 1701, the system will automatically tag that posting with the "Sales" functional area, allowing for functional P&L reporting.

For Consultants: Key Customizing & Technical Notes

Activate Cost of Sales Accounting: This is the master switch. It's activated per company code in SPRO: Financial Accounting (New) -> Financial Accounting Global Settings (New) -> Ledgers -> Ledger -> Assign Scenarios and Customer Fields to Ledgers. The scenario FIN_UKV must be assigned. You also define whether it's active or in preparation for migration.

Define Functional Areas: The functional areas themselves are created in SPRO: Financial Accounting -> Financial Accounting Global Settings -> Functional Area -> Define Functional Area. This is where you create codes like YB10 and give them the description "Production".

Derivation Logic: SAP's logic for finding the functional area is a hierarchy26262626:

It checks for a manual entry during posting.

It looks for a value from a substitution rule (event 0006).

It checks the G/L Account master record.

Finally, it checks the master record of the assigned cost object (e.g., Cost Center, Internal Order).

The value from the G/L account

overwrites the value from the cost object27. This is a critical point to remember during design.

Chapter 4: Products & Services - The Material Master (MM, SD)

The Material Master is the heart of all logistics. It contains all the information required to manage a material (or service). This includes data for purchasing, sales, production, accounting, and more. We will create a "Service" material, which represents a service we sell rather than a physical product.

4.1. Creating a Service Material

The Big Picture:

Why create a "material" for a service? In SAP, the material master provides a robust framework for managing anything you procure, produce, or sell. By creating a service material (e.g., "Consulting Hour" or "Repair Service"), we can use all the standard sales and billing processes. We can give it a price, sell it on a sales order, and bill a customer for it, just like a physical product.

The key difference is that a service material is not inventory-managed. We don't have a stock of "Consulting Hours" in a warehouse.

Step-by-Step Instructions (How-To):

This task is typically performed by a Master Data Steward or someone in Product Management.

Access the Create Material App:

Fiori App: Create Material

SAP GUI: Transaction Code MM01

Initial Screen:

Material: You can leave this blank for the system to assign a number, or enter your own if using an external number range28.

Industry sector: Select S (Services)29.

Material type: Select DIEN (Service)30. This is the key setting that controls the material's behavior.

Press Enter.

Select Views: A pop-up appears asking which data "views" you want to create. A view is a tab of data for a specific department (e.g., Sales view, Purchasing view). Select the following31:

Basic Data 1, Basic Data 2

Sales: Sales Org. Data 1, Sales Org. Data 2, General/Plant Data

Sales Text

Click Continue (Enter).

Define Organizational Levels: The system now asks for which parts of the company you are creating these views.

Plant: 1000 32

Sales Org.: 1000 (Domestic Sales) 33

Distr. Channel:

10 (Direct Sales) 34

Click Continue (Enter). This means you are creating the sales views for selling this service from Plant 1000 via the domestic direct sales channel.

Fill in the Data Views: Now, you'll go through each view you selected and enter the data.

Basic Data 1 Tab:

Description: Give the service a clear name, e.g., On-Site Repair Service35.

Base Unit of Measure: H (Hour) or AU (Activity Unit)36.

Material Group: YB* (Select an appropriate service group)37.

Division: 10 (High-Tech Products). The division helps in segmenting your business38.

GenItemCatGroup: LEIS (Service w/o Delivery)39. This is another critical setting for services.

Sales: Sales Org. 1 Tab:

Delivering Plant: 100040. Even for a service, a plant is needed for organizational assignment.

Tax classification: Enter the code relevant to your country's tax laws (e.g., 1 for Taxable)41.

Sales: Sales Org. 2 Tab:

Acct assignment grp: Y1 (Service Provider)42. This is a crucial link to Finance! It helps the system determine the correct G/L revenue account to post to when this service is billed.

Item category group: LEIS (Service w/o Delivery)43. This must match the entry in Basic Data 1.

Sales: General/Plant Tab:

Profit Center: Select the profit center that will be credited with the revenue from this service (e.g., YB<*>)44. This is for profitability analysis.

Sales Text Tab:

Here you can enter a longer text that will automatically appear on sales orders and invoices when this service is sold45. For example: "Standard on-site repair service, billed per hour. Travel time not included."

Save the Material: Click the Save button. The system will confirm that the material has been created.

Result: You have successfully created a service material master. You can now create a price for it and sell it to customers.

Follow-Up Process: Creating a Sales Price

A material is useless without a price. You need to run the

Create Sales Price Condition process to set the price (e.g., $150 per hour) for your new service material46. This is done using a Fiori App like

Set Material Prices - Sales or transaction VK11.

For Consultants: Key Customizing & Technical Notes

Material Types (OMSF): The material type DIEN is the key. In SPRO, under Logistics - General -> Material Master -> Basic Settings -> Material Types -> Define Attributes of Material Types, you can see the configuration for DIEN. Note that the "Quantity updating" and "Value updating" indicators are typically unchecked, meaning the system doesn't track inventory for this type.

Item Category Group (GenItemCatGroup/Item category group): The value LEIS drives how the material behaves in a sales order. The system uses this value, combined with the sales document type, to determine the "Item Category" (e.g., TAD).

Item Category Determination (VOV4): The item category TAD for services is configured to be non-delivery-relevant and to have a specific billing relevance (e.g., order-related billing).

Account Assignment Group: This field (MARC-KTGRM) on the Sales Org 2 view is a key part of SD-FI integration. The configuration in SPRO (Sales and Distribution -> Basic Functions -> Account Assignment/Costing -> Revenue Account Determination -> Assign G/L Accounts) uses a combination of criteria, including this group, to find the correct revenue G/L account.

Chapter 5: Technical Assets - Locations & Equipment (PM/CS)

For a company like Global Tech Inc. that services equipment, it's vital to have a structured representation of the assets they maintain—both their own and their customers'. In SAP, these are called Technical Objects. The highest level of this structure is the Functional Location.

5.1. Creating a Functional Location

The Big Picture:

Think of a Functional Location as a place where a technical task is performed. It's a hierarchical structure that represents a system, a building, or a specific area. For example, a customer's site could be structured like this:

CUST-01 (Customer Main Site)

CUST-01-BLD1 (Building 1)

CUST-01-BLD1-PROD (Production Line)

CUST-01-BLD1-PROD-ROBOT (Welding Robot)

This structure allows you to track maintenance history, costs, and activities at any level. You can see how much it costs to maintain the entire building, or just one specific robot. We'll create a simple, single-level functional location.

Step-by-Step Instructions (How-To):

This task is typically performed by a Plant Maintenance or Customer Service Planner.

Access the Create Functional Location App:

Fiori App: Create Technical Object (and then select Functional Location)

SAP GUI: Transaction Code IL01

Initial Screen:

Functional loc.: You need to enter a value that matches the pre-defined structure mask. For example,

YB50000/0000000147. The '/' separates hierarchy levels. Let's create

GTI-SITE-01 for a new customer site.

StrIndicator: This defines the structure mask. Use the pre-configured one, e.g.,

ISRE48.

FunctLocCat.: S (for customer equipment)49.

Press Enter to confirm50.

Master Data Screen: You will now enter the details for this location.

General Tab:

Description: Enter a clear text, e.g., Global Tech - Customer Main Site A51.

Location Tab:

MaintPlant: 100052. This is the plant responsible for planning and executing work at this location.

Organization Tab:

Cost Center: 170153. This is the cost center that will be responsible for costs incurred at this location, unless a more specific object is used (like a PM Order).

Main WorkCtr: SERV0154. This is the main group of technicians responsible for work at this location.

Sales and Distribution Tab:

Sales Org: 1000 55

Distrib.channel: 10 56

Division: 10 57

This data is optional but useful if you are linking service processes directly to sales contracts or billing.

Save the Functional Location: Click the Save button. The system will confirm the creation and provide you with the number.

Result: You've created a functional location. You can now install pieces of equipment (another type of technical object) at this location, create service notifications if there's a problem, and generate maintenance orders to fix it.

For Consultants: Key Customizing & Technical Notes

Structure Indicator (SPRO): The edit mask for creating functional locations is defined here: Plant Maintenance and Customer Service -> Master Data in Plant Maintenance and Customer Service -> Technical Objects -> Functional Locations -> Create Structure Indicator for Reference Locations/Functional Locations. This is where you define the hierarchy levels and the length/type of characters allowed.

Functional Location Category (SPRO): Configuration here controls the screen layouts, number ranges, and other specific settings for different types of locations: Plant Maintenance and Customer Service -> Master Data in Plant Maintenance and Customer Service -> Technical Objects -> Functional Locations -> Define Category of Functional Location.

Integration with FI/CO: The Cost Center on the Organization tab is a default. When a Maintenance or Service Order is created for this Functional Location, costs can be settled to this cost center, or to another cost receiver specified in the order itself. This is a primary PM/CS-to-CO integration point.

Chapter 6: Ensuring Quality - The Inspection Characteristic (QM)

To ensure Global Tech Inc.'s products meet high standards, they need to perform quality inspections. The foundation of any inspection is defining what you are going to check. In SAP Quality Management (QM), these checks are called Master Inspection Characteristics (MICs).

6.1. Creating a Master Inspection Characteristic

The Big Picture:

An MIC is a reusable template for an inspection criterion. Instead of re-typing "Check surface for scratches" every time you create an inspection plan, you create one MIC for it. This MIC defines not just the description, but also how the inspection is performed and how results are recorded.

There are two main types:

Quantitative: The result is a number (e.g., "Measure Length," with a target of 100mm +/- 2mm).

Qualitative: The result is an attribute or a decision (e.g., "Overall Appearance," with possible results of "OK" or "Not OK").

We will create a qualitative MIC.

Step-by-Step Instructions (How-To):

This task is performed by a Quality Planner or Engineer.

Access the Create Master Inspection Characteristic App:

Fiori App: Manage Master Inspection Characteristics

SAP GUI: Transaction Code QS21

Initial Screen:

Plant: 100058. MICs can be created at the plant level or cross-plant (client level).

Master insp. charac.: YMIC01 (Give it a unique name)59.

Valid from: Current date60.

Press Enter.

General Data Screen:

Select the

Qualitative Charac. radio button61.

Short text: OVERALL APPEARANCE62.

Status: 2 (Released)63.

Press Enter.

Control Indicators: This is the most important screen. It's a series of checkboxes that control the MIC's behavior. Click the "Control indicators" button.

Charac. attribute: Check this box for qualitative characteristics64.

Required char.: Check this box. It means a result

must be recorded for this check during an inspection65.

Defects recording: Check this box. This allows the inspector to create a quality notification directly from the results recording screen if they find a defect66.

Select other indicators like

Single result, Fixed scope, No documentation, and Print as needed67.

Press Continue (Enter).

Assign Catalogs: For a qualitative MIC, you need to define the possible results (the "codes"). These are stored in "Catalogs."

Click the

"Catalogs" button68.

In the CGr/SSet (Code Group / Selected Set) field, enter the code group that contains the results you want to allow. For example,

YB02-01 might contain the codes "OK" (Accepted) and "NOK" (Rejected)69.

You can also specify a defect code to be proposed if the result is a rejection70.

Press Enter.

Save the MIC: Click the Save button.

Result: You have created a reusable Master Inspection Characteristic. Now, you can add this MIC to an Inspection Plan or a Material Specification. When a quality inspection is triggered for a product (e.g., upon goods receipt from a supplier), the system will tell the inspector to check the "OVERALL APPEARANCE" and record a result of "OK" or "Not OK."

For Consultants: Key Customizing & Technical Notes

Catalogs (QS41/QS51): The foundation for qualitative MICs. Catalogs (Type 1 for Characteristic Attributes, Type 9 for Defect Codes) are configured by creating Code Groups (e.g., APPEARANCE) and then assigning Codes to them (e.g., OK, SCRATCH, DENT). Selected Sets are predefined subsets of code groups for easier use.

Control Indicators: The behavior of an MIC is almost entirely controlled by these indicators. Understanding each checkbox is critical for a QM consultant. This configuration is stored in client-level tables (T_QPMK), but the assignment to an MIC is in table QPMK.

Inspection Plans (QP01): The primary use of MICs is to build inspection plans. In an inspection plan for a material, you list the sequence of operations and the MICs to be inspected at each step. This plan is then used to generate an Inspection Lot when an inspection is triggered.

Part 3: The Ultimate SAP S/4HANA Test Plan

A system is only as good as it's been tested. This section provides a comprehensive test plan that you can use to validate the master data setup and end-to-end processes at Global Tech Inc. This plan is designed for all users—end-users can follow the steps to learn the system, key users can use it for User Acceptance Testing (UAT), and consultants can use it to verify their configuration.

Chapter 7: Test Plan - Foundational Master Data

This chapter validates the creation of the core master data objects we discussed in Part 2.

Test Scenario MD-01: Create and Verify a New Employee

Objective: To ensure a new employee can be successfully hired in the system.

Prerequisites: Organizational structure (Personnel Area, etc.) must be configured. Cost Centers must exist.

Fiori App(s): Run Personnel Actions, Display HR Master Data

GUI T-Code(s): PA40, PA20

Test Step

Expected Result

Actual Result

Pass/Fail

1. Go to PA40 and start the "Hiring" action for a new employee, John Smith, with a start date of today. Use Personnel Area 1000.

The system initiates the hiring process and presents the "Actions" infotype screen.

  

2. Complete the Actions, Organizational Assignment (use Cost Center 1101), and Personal Data infotypes. Save each one.

The system accepts the data, saves each infotype, and moves to the next one in the sequence. No errors are displayed.

  

3. Complete the hiring action until you get a confirmation message. Note the new Personnel Number.

A message "Personnel number XXXXXXXX hired" is displayed.

  

4. Go to PA20 (Display HR Master Data). Enter the new Personnel Number and view Infotype 0001 (Organizational Assignment).

The screen displays the correct data entered during hiring, including the assigned Cost Center 1101.

  

For Consultants: Verify the accounting document posting for a payroll run simulation for this employee. Check cost center reports.

Payroll simulation shows costs correctly being allocated to cost center 1101, which has the 'Admin' Functional Area.

  

Test Scenario MD-02: Extend Employee to Sales Representative

Objective: To validate that an existing employee can be assigned to a sales role.

Prerequisites: Test Scenario MD-01 must be complete. A sales structure (Sales Org, Office, Group) must exist.

Fiori App(s): Maintain HR Master Data

GUI T-Code(s): PA30

Test Step

Expected Result

Actual Result

Pass/Fail

1. Go to PA30. Enter the Personnel Number for John Smith (from MD-01).

The system recognizes the employee and is ready for data maintenance.

  

2. In the infotype field, enter 0900 (Sales Data) and click the "Create" icon.

The "Create Sales Data" screen appears.

  

3. Enter Sales Organization 1000, Sales Office 100, and Sales Group 100. Save the record.

The record is saved without errors. A confirmation message appears.

  

4. Re-display Infotype 0900 for John Smith.

The data entered in Step 3 is displayed correctly.

  

Integration Test Point: Create a Sales Order (Transaction VA01) in Sales Area 1000/10/10. In the partner functions, try to assign John Smith as the Sales Employee.

The system finds and accepts John Smith as a valid partner for the "Sales Employee" function.

  

Test Scenario MD-03: Maintain Financial Master Data for Reporting

Objective: To verify that Functional Areas can be assigned to cost objects to enable Cost of Sales Accounting.

Prerequisites: Cost Centers and G/L accounts must exist. Functional Areas must be configured.

Fiori App(s): Manage Cost Centers, Manage G/L Account Master Data

GUI T-Code(s): KS02, FS00

Test Step

Expected Result

Actual Result

Pass/Fail

1. Go to KS02 and select a cost center used for sales activities (e.g., 1701).

The "Change Cost Center" screen appears.

  

2. On the "Basic Screen" tab, enter the Functional Area for Sales (e.g., YB40) and save.

The change is saved without error.

  

3. Go to FS00 and select a G/L account for a specific production expense (e.g., 400100 - Factory Supplies).

The G/L account master data is displayed.

  

4. In the "Type/Description" tab, enter the Functional Area for Production (e.g., YB10) and save.

The change is saved without error.

  

Integration Test Point: Post a vendor invoice (FB60) to G/L account 400100 and Cost Center 1701.

The system should prioritize the Functional Area from the G/L Account. The resulting journal entry should have the Functional Area YB10 (Production) assigned, not YB40 (Sales).

  

For Consultants: Check the configuration for Cost of Sales Accounting in SPRO to ensure it is active for the company code being tested. Path: Financial Accounting -> ... -> Activate Cost of Sales Accounting.

The status should be "Active".

  

Test Scenario MD-04: Create and Verify a Service Material

Objective: To ensure a new service material can be created correctly with all necessary views for sales and accounting.

Prerequisites: Organizational structures (Plant, Sales Org, etc.) are configured.

Fiori App(s): Create Material

GUI T-Code(s): MM01, MM03

Test Step

Expected Result

Actual Result

Pass/Fail

1. Go to MM01. Use Industry Sector S and Material Type DIEN.

The system is ready to create a service material.

  

2. Select views: Basic Data 1 & 2, all Sales views, Sales Text.

The organizational level pop-up appears.

  

3. Enter Plant 1000, Sales Org 1000, and Distr. Channel 10.

The system proceeds to the "Basic Data 1" tab.

  

4. Enter all required data as specified in the guide: Description, Base Unit (H), Division (10), GenItemCatGroup (LEIS).

The data is accepted.

  

5. In the Sales Org 2 view, enter Acct assignment grp Y1. In the General/Plant view, enter a valid Profit Center.

The data is accepted. This is a critical step for financial integration.

  

6. Save the material and note the new material number.

The system confirms "Material XXXXXXXX created".

  

7. Go to MM03 (Display Material) and check the "Sales Org. 2" view and "Accounting 1" view for the created material.

The Account Assignment Group is correctly displayed. Because this is a DIEN material, the Accounting 1 view should show that it is not value-managed.

  

Test Scenario MD-05: Create a Functional Location for Service

Objective: To validate the creation of a technical object structure for use in service management.

Prerequisites: Plant Maintenance organizational structure (e.g., Maintenance Plant) must be configured.

Fiori App(s): Create Technical Object

GUI T-Code(s): IL01, IL03

Test Step

Expected Result

Actual Result

Pass/Fail

1. Go to IL01. Enter a new Functional Location ID (e.g., GTI-CUST-SITE-B) and Category S. Use Structure Indicator ISRE.

The "Create Functional Location: Master Data" screen appears.

  

2. Enter a Description. On the Location tab, enter MaintPlant 1000.

The data is accepted.

  

3. On the Organization tab, enter Cost Center 1701 and Main Work Center SERV01.

The data is accepted.

  

**4. ** Save the Functional Location and note the number.

The system confirms creation.

  

5. Go to IL03 (Display Functional Location) and enter the new ID.

All data entered in the previous steps is displayed correctly across the tabs.

  

Test Scenario MD-06: Create a Master Inspection Characteristic

Objective: To ensure a qualitative check can be defined for use in quality plans.

Prerequisites: Catalogs (Code Groups and Codes) for "Accepted" and "Rejected" must be configured.

Fiori App(s): Manage Master Inspection Characteristics

GUI T-Code(s): QS21, QS24

Test Step

Expected Result

Actual Result

Pass/Fail

1. Go to QS21. Enter Plant 1000 and a new MIC name (e.g., Y_SURFACE_FINISH).

The "General Data" screen appears.

  

2. Select "Qualitative Charac.", enter a Short Text, set Status to "Released".

The data is accepted.

  

3. Go to "Control Indicators" and select "Charac. attribute", "Required char.", and "Defects recording". Press Enter.

The settings are saved and you are returned to the main screen.

  

4. Go to "Catalogs" and assign a valid Selected Set (e.g., YB02-01) that contains "Accepted" and "Rejected" codes. Save the MIC.

The MIC is saved without error.

  

5. Go to QS24 (Display MIC) for your new MIC.

All control indicators and catalog assignments are displayed as you set them.

  

For Consultants: Verify the catalog configuration using QS41 (Edit Catalog Code Groups) and QS51 (Edit Selected Sets) to ensure YB02-01 exists and contains the correct codes.

The code group and selected set are correctly configured and released for use.

  

This guide continues into Part 4, covering End-to-End process flows and their corresponding test plans, integrating all the master data created above into realistic business scenarios like Order-to-Cash and Procure-to-Pay.

 

 

Here is the continuation of the comprehensive guide and integrated test plan for SAP S/4HANA.

Part 4: End-to-End Business Processes in Action

Now that we've laid the foundation with our core master data, let's bring Global Tech Inc. to life. In this section, we'll walk through the day-to-day business processes, showing how different SAP modules work together seamlessly. We'll use the very master data we created in the previous chapters.

Chapter 8: Order-to-Cash (O2C) - Selling Products and Services

The Big Picture: 🚀

The Order-to-Cash process is the lifeblood of most companies. It covers every step from a customer placing an order to the company receiving payment for it. For Global Tech Inc., this involves selling both physical high-tech products and the repair services we defined earlier.

Process Flow:

Sales Inquiry (Optional) -> Sales Quotation (Optional) -> Sales Order -> Outbound Delivery (for goods) -> Picking & Goods Issue -> Billing/Invoicing -> Incoming Payment

We will focus on the core flow starting from the Sales Order.

Step-by-Step Instructions (How-To):

This process involves roles from Sales, Warehousing, and Accounting.

  1. Create a Sales Order

A customer has called and wants to order one unit of the "GT-1000 Smart Sensor" and also wants to book 5 hours of our "On-Site Repair Service" for a future date. Our sales representative, John Smith, will create the order.

  • Fiori App: Create Sales Orders
  • GUI T-Code: VA01
  1. On the initial screen, enter the Order Type. For a standard sale, this is typically OR (Standard Order).
  2. Enter the Sales Area data: Sales Organization (1000), Distribution Channel (10), and Division (10).
  3. Press Enter.
  4. On the main "Create Standard Order" screen:
    • Sold-To Party: Enter the customer number who is placing the order.
    • Cust. Reference: Enter the customer's Purchase Order number (e.g., PO-CUST-123).
    • Go to the "Sales" tab and in the Partner section, find the PE (Sales Employee) partner function and enter the personnel number for John Smith (999301). This links the sale to him.
  5. Now, enter the line items the customer is ordering:
    • Line 10:
      • Material: Enter the material number for the physical product (e.g., GT-1000).
      • Order Quantity: 1.
    • Line 20:
      • Material: Enter the material number for our On-Site Repair Service (created in MD-04).
      • Order Quantity: 5. The unit of measure should automatically appear as H (Hour).
  6. Press Enter. The system will automatically determine prices and check material availability.
  7. Click Save. The system will confirm with a message: "Standard Order XXXXX has been saved." Make a note of this number.
  1. Create the Outbound Delivery (for the physical good)

The service doesn't need delivery, but the GT-1000 Smart Sensor does. The warehouse team is now notified that an item needs to be shipped.

  • Fiori App: Create Outbound Deliveries - From Sales Orders
  • GUI T-Code: VL01N
  1. Shipping Point: Enter 1000.
  2. Selection date: Enter the date the delivery should be created (e.g., today).
  3. Order: Enter the Sales Order number you just created.
  4. Press Enter.
  5. The system creates a delivery document showing only the physical item (GT-1000). The service item is not here because it's not physically shipped.
  6. Go to the "Picking" tab and enter 1 in the Picked Qty field.
  7. Click Post Goods Issue (PGI).

Integration Point: Clicking PGI is a critical step. It does three things at once:

  • Reduces inventory of the GT-1000 sensor by one piece (MM integration).
  • Posts the Cost of Goods Sold to the finance ledger (FI/CO integration).
  • Marks the delivery as complete, allowing it to be billed (SD integration).
  1. Create the Invoice (Billing)

Now that the goods have been shipped and the service has been agreed upon in the order, the finance department can bill the customer for both.

  • Fiori App: Create Billing Documents
  • GUI T-Code: VF01
  1. On the initial screen, the system will propose documents that are due for billing. Your sales order and delivery document should appear.
  2. Enter the number of the Sales Order or Delivery document you wish to bill.
  3. Click Execute.
  4. The system shows a preview of the invoice with two lines: one for the GT-1000 sensor and one for the 5 hours of repair service.
  5. Click Save.

Integration Point: Saving the invoice is another huge integration event. It:

  • Creates an open Accounts Receivable item on the customer's account (FI integration).
  • Posts the revenue to the correct G/L accounts in finance (FI/CO integration). The system uses the Account Assignment Group (Y1) from our service material master to help determine the right revenue account for the service line.
  • Updates sales statistics and credit management.

Result: The core O2C flow is complete. The final step would be for the accounts receivable team to post the incoming payment from the customer when it arrives, clearing the open invoice.

For Consultants: Key Customizing & Technical Notes

  • Sales Document Type (VOV8): Configuration for OR (Standard Order) controls everything from number ranges to the billing types allowed.
  • Item Category Determination (VOV4): The system determines the Item Category for each line item (e.g., TAN for standard items, TAD for services) based on the Sales Doc Type and the Item Category Group from the material master (NORM for goods, LEIS for services). The item category controls whether a line is relevant for delivery, pricing, billing, etc.
  • Copy Control (VTLA, VTFL): This powerful configuration defines how data flows from one document to the next (e.g., from Sales Order to Delivery, or Delivery to Billing). It controls which items are copied and how quantities are handled.
  • Revenue Account Determination (VKOA): This is the heart of SD-FI integration. It's a matrix where you define rules for how the system finds the revenue G/L account. The rules use criteria like the Account Assignment Groups from the customer and material masters.

Chapter 9: Procure-to-Pay (P2P) - Buying What We Need

The Big Picture: 🛒

Global Tech Inc. can't make its smart sensors without components. The Procure-to-Pay process covers the entire purchasing cycle, from identifying a need to paying the supplier (vendor).

Process Flow:

Purchase Requisition -> Purchase Order -> Goods Receipt -> Invoice Verification -> Outgoing Payment

We'll create a simple raw material, create a purchase order for it, receive it into our warehouse, and process the supplier's invoice.

Step-by-Step Instructions (How-To):

This process involves roles from Purchasing, Warehousing, and Accounts Payable.

(Prerequisite: We need a raw material master (Material Type ROH) and a vendor master created in the system.)

  1. Create a Purchase Order

A planner has determined we need 100 units of a component, "Microcontroller Chip MC-100", from our supplier, "Global Chips Corp."

  • Fiori App: Manage Purchase Orders (or Create Purchase Order - Advanced)
  • GUI T-Code: ME21N
  1. In the header section, enter the Vendor number for "Global Chips Corp."
  2. Ensure the Org. Data tab has the correct Purchasing Org. (1000), Purch. Group, and Company Code (1000).
  3. In the "Item Overview" section, create a line item:
    • Material: MC-100
    • PO Quantity: 100
    • Plant: 1000
    • Net Price: Enter the price per chip agreed with the vendor.
  4. Press Enter. The system will pull in data from the material and vendor master records.
  5. Check the document for errors (look for red lights in the status column).
  6. Click Save. The system confirms, "Standard PO created under the number XXXXXXXXXX." Note this number.
  1. Post Goods Receipt

The truck from Global Chips Corp. has arrived at our warehouse with the 100 microcontrollers. The warehouse clerk needs to record this receipt.

  • Fiori App: Post Goods Receipt for Purchase Order
  • GUI T-Code: MIGO
  1. On the initial screen, ensure the action is A1 - Goods Receipt and the reference is R01 - Purchase Order.
  2. In the field to the right, enter your Purchase Order number and press Enter.
  3. The system will copy the data from the PO. You'll see a line for 100 units of MC-100.
  4. In the "Quantity" tab, confirm the quantity is 100.
  5. In the "Where" tab, specify the Storage Location where you are placing the stock (e.g., 101A).
  6. Check the "Item OK" box at the bottom.
  7. Click Post.

Integration Point: Posting the Goods Receipt is a major event. It:

  • Increases the inventory of MC-100 by 100 pieces (MM).
  • Creates a material document to record the movement.
  • Creates an accounting document that debits the inventory G/L account and credits the "GR/IR" (Goods Receipt / Invoice Receipt) clearing account (FI). This GR/IR account acts as a temporary holding account until the vendor's invoice arrives.
  1. Create Supplier Invoice

The Accounts Payable team has received an invoice from Global Chips Corp. for the 100 microcontrollers. They need to enter it into the system and match it against the purchase order and goods receipt.

  • Fiori App: Create Supplier Invoice
  • GUI T-Code: MIRO
  1. Enter the Invoice date and a Reference (the vendor's invoice number).
  2. In the PO reference tab, enter your Purchase Order number and press Enter.
  3. The system will pull in the expected amount based on the PO and the quantity received from the Goods Receipt.
  4. Enter the Amount from the vendor's invoice (including tax) into the header.
  5. The system will show a Balance at the top right. If your entered amount matches the system's expected amount, the balance will be zero and the light will be green. If not, the light will be red, indicating a mismatch that needs investigation.
  6. Assuming the balance is zero, click Post.

Integration Point: Posting the invoice:

  • Debits the GR/IR clearing account (clearing out the temporary posting from the Goods Receipt).
  • Credits the Vendor's sub-ledger account, creating an open accounts payable item (FI).
  • Posts any tax amounts to the tax G/L accounts.

Result: The P2P process is complete up to payment. The final step is for the AP team to run the payment program (F110) to pay the vendor's open invoice.

For Consultants: Key Customizing & Technical Notes

  • Purchasing Org Structure: The setup of Purchasing Organizations and their assignment to Company Codes and Plants is fundamental. SPRO: Enterprise Structure -> Assignment -> Materials Management.
  • Automatic Account Determination (OBYC): This is the MM-FI integration powerhouse. It's a complex configuration table where you define rules for which G/L accounts are posted for different inventory movements. For example, the posting at Goods Receipt (transaction key BSX for inventory, WRX for GR/IR) is configured here based on the Valuation Class in the material master.
  • Tolerance Limits (OMR6): In Invoice Verification (MIRO), the system checks for variances between the PO price/quantity and the invoice price/quantity. The tolerance limits for acceptable variances are configured here. If a variance exceeds the tolerance, the invoice is blocked for payment.

Part 5: The Ultimate Test Plan - End-to-End Scenarios

This part of the test plan validates the complete business flows, ensuring that the master data and configuration we set up work together correctly across modules.

Test Scenario E2E-01: Order-to-Cash for Service and Goods

  • Objective: To execute and verify the complete O2C process, including selling a physical good and a service on the same order, and to check the financial postings.
  • Prerequisites: All master data from MD-01 through MD-04 must be created. A customer master and a physical product master (e.g., GT-1000) must exist. Pricing conditions must be maintained.
  • Fiori App(s) / GUI T-Code(s): VA01, VL01N, VF01, FBL5N

Test Step

Expected Result

Actual Result

Pass/Fail

1. (VA01) Create a Standard Order (OR) for a customer.

The sales order creation screen opens.

  

2. Add John Smith (from MD-02) as the Sales Employee partner.

The system accepts the employee number.

  

3. Add one line for a physical good (GT-1000, quantity 1) and a second line for the service material (On-Site Repair Service, quantity 5). Save the order.

The order is saved without errors. Note the Sales Order number.

  

4. (VL01N) Create an Outbound Delivery with reference to the Sales Order.

The delivery document is created containing only the line for the physical good (GT-1000). The service material does not appear.

  

5. In the delivery, pick the quantity and click Post Goods Issue.

Goods issue is posted. A material document and an accounting document are created.

  

6. (VF01) Create a Billing Document with reference to the Sales Order or Delivery.

The billing document is created containing both line items (for the good and the service).

  

7. (VF03) Display the accounting document created by the invoice.

The accounting document shows a Debit to the Customer's account and Credits to the Revenue G/L accounts.

  

8. (FBL5N) Display the Customer Line Item report for the customer.

The report shows an open invoice for the total amount, matching the billing document.

  

For Consultants: In the accounting document from step 7, verify that the revenue for the service line item posted to the G/L account specified in the VKOA setup for the Account Assignment Group Y1.

The revenue is posted to the correct, service-specific G/L account, proving the SD-FI integration configuration is working.

  

Test Scenario E2E-02: Procure-to-Pay with Quality Inspection

  • Objective: To execute and verify the complete P2P process, including a quality inspection at goods receipt, and to check the financial postings.
  • Prerequisites: A raw material (ROH) and a vendor master exist. The raw material master must have the QM view activated and an inspection type (01) assigned. An Inspection Plan must be created for the material using the MIC from MD-06.
  • Fiori App(s) / GUI T-Code(s): ME21N, MIGO, QA32, QE51N, MIRO, FBL1N

Test Step

Expected Result

Actual Result

Pass/Fail

1. (ME21N) Create a Purchase Order for 100 units of the QM-active raw material. Save and note the PO number.

The PO is created successfully.

  

2. (MIGO) Post a Goods Receipt against the PO.

The GR is posted. The system automatically creates an Inspection Lot. A message confirming this appears.

  

3. Check the stock of the material (MMBE).

The 100 units are now visible in the plant, but they are in "Quality Inspection" stock, not Unrestricted-use stock. They cannot be used yet.

  

4. (QA32) Find the inspection lot created in step 2. The status should be REL (Released). Select the lot and click "Results".

The results recording screen (QE51N) opens. The MIC for "Overall Appearance" (from MD-06) is displayed, waiting for a result.

  

5. In the results screen, select the code for "OK" (Accepted) and save.

The results are saved. The status of the inspection lot is now INSP (Inspection results recorded).

  

6. (QA32) Go back to the inspection lot list. Select the same lot and click "Usage Decision".

The Usage Decision screen opens.

  

7. In the UD Code field, select "A" (Accept). Go to the "Inspection lot stock" tab. The system should propose moving 100 units from Quality stock to Unrestricted. Save the UD.

The Usage Decision is saved. The system automatically posts a material movement in the background (e.g., movement type 321).

  

8. Check the stock of the material again (MMBE).

The 100 units have now moved from "Quality Inspection" stock to "Unrestricted-use" stock. They are now available for production.

  

9. (MIRO) Process and post the supplier invoice against the PO.

The invoice is posted without errors, and the balance is zero.

  

10. (FBL1N) Display the Vendor Line Item report.

The report shows an open invoice for the total amount, waiting to be paid.

  

For Consultants: Display the material document for the Usage Decision posting (from step 7). Check the accounting document to ensure no financial posting occurred (as it's just a stock type change within the same plant).

The 321 movement does not create an FI document, which is correct. The financial impact already occurred at the initial Goods Receipt in step 2. This confirms the MM-FI integration logic for stock movements.

entry.title: Re: SAP Datasphere Error during package import
entry.content:
Hi,

First try if the view does not contain data (persistency). With changes DSP will not remove the data automatically as it does not know whether you may not need the 'old' version of the data. 

Also, it is possible that the view is 'released'? 

Else use: DW Administrator role and retry 

Please post results here 

Cheers,

Martin

entry.title: Embedded Finance in SAP: SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity with J.P. Morgan Payments
entry.content:
Enterprises are rethinking how to connect banking capabilities with ERP processes to maximize business value. Key questions include:

  • How to make payments, reconciliation, and cash visibility seamless and fully integrated between banks and the ERP system?
  • How to adopt innovations like real-time payments or real-time cash balances without launching a new IT project every time a banking service gets added?
  • How to unlock the combined value of invoice and payment data in the ERP alongside the cash and financial data held by banks?

SAP and J.P. Morgan asked themselves the same questions. And as a result decided to collaborate and partner even closer to bring more value to shared clients by better integrating the capabilities of both by accelerating adoption of SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity (MBC) to deliver J.P. Morgan bank services embedded in ERP processes.

With SAP MBC, corporates get direct, standardized access to J.P. Morgan banking services directly integrated into their payment and cash processes. As a result corporates can scale new services faster, without custom builds and with minimal ongoing maintenance and benefit from the seamless and many times real time data flow to get the decision advantage crucial in todays fast and ever changing business world.

What you can expect

  • Seamless connectivity: Integrate J.P. Morgan services via SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity to connect your SAP ERP to J.P. Morgan Payments using standardized, bank-approved channels.
  • Automate payments and reporting: The J.P. Morgan Payments Adapter 2.0 supports file-based payments (ACH, checks, virtual cards, wires—including FX) and real-time payments across the U.S., EU, UK, Australia, Singapore, Malaysia, and Hong Kong.
  • Real-time insights: Access instant reporting and reconciliation, view account balances and transaction details, and track payments through advanced APIs.
  • Easy implementation: Prebuilt adapters and help you go live quickly and securely
  • AI-powered treasury: Leverage SAP’s cloud data foundation and AI-driven capabilities to interact with J.P. Morgan and elevate treasury operations.

Who can benefit

  • New and existing J.P. Morgan clients using SAP S/4HANA (Public Cloud, Private Cloud, or On-Premise) or SAP ECC (6.0+)
  • Organizations operating on J.P. Morgan Access, with support for multi-bank reporting across non–J.P. Morgan DDAs
  • Teams seeking flexible connection options through SAP MBC to tailor integrations to specific business needs

This collaboration meets clients where they are simplifying connectivity while strengthening control and visibility at the same time, and accelerating access to new banking innovations, all embedded in SAP ERP processes.

Want to know more?

  • SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity 
    • https://www.sap.com/germany/products/financial-management/multi-bank-connectivity.html 
    • https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_MULTI_BANK_CONNECTIVITY
  • J.P. Morgan SAP Integration:
    • https://partners.jpmorgan.com/sap_s4hana.html
  • SAP and J.P. Morgan Partnership:
    • https://digital.jpmorgan.com/jpmorgan-with-sap/index.html

Still want to know more?

Meet us at the AFP Conference in Boston on October 26–29 or attend SAP and J.P. Morgan session at the AFP and J.P. Morgan Booth on Tuesday Oct 28th  2-2.30pm local Boston time

entry.title: SAP Developer News September 25th, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION 

Podcast: https://podcast.opensap.info/sap-developers/2025/09/25/sap-developer-news-september-25th-2025/ 

Devtoberfest Begins 

  • https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/gh-p/Devtoberfest 
  • https://www.youtube.com/@sapdevs 
  • https://www.linkedin.com/showcase/sap-community-official/ 

Devtoberfest Fun Activities 

  • Devtoberfest Fun, Week 1: Scavenger Hunt: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/fun-for-week-1-the-devtoberfest-scavenger-hunt/ba-p/14183972 
  • Tutorial for checking hex digits for each mission: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/devtoberfest2025-scavenger-hunt-checking.html 
  • Tutorial for entering the secret phrase: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/devtoberfest2025-scavenger-hunt.html 

Favorites and Recent in SAP BTP cockpit 

  • Blog post: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/introducing-favorites-and-recent-in-sap-btp-cockpit-a-personalized/ba-p/14217622 

SAPUI5 version 1.140 

  • Release notes: https://ui5.sap.com/#/topic/26a106cc313d48e6b52b78c7c331f818 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 Devtoberfest Begins 

1:16 TechEd Promo from the TechEd Recording in NSQ on Wednesday 

2:25 Devtoberfest Fun Activities 

5:05 Favorites and Recent in SAP BTP cockpit 

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for September 25th, 2025.

[Kevin] Hey folks, Kevin here. Devtoberfest 2025 is almost here. Launching next week on Monday, September 29th. Get ready for over 80 expert-led sessions. Packed with knowledge, innovation, and real-world developer insights. And it's not just tech talk. We've got loads of fun. joined our legendary scavenger hunt, adorable pet-toberfest, mind-bending puzzles, and exciting coders' challenges. Earn participation points as you go and get a shot at the grand prize just by joining in and having fun. All sessions will stream live on YouTube via the SAP Developers channel. By the way, thank you for 50,000 subscribers. And you can also find them linked on our SAP Community LinkedIn events. So on one end, find all the details and join the fun in the SAP community. As always, the link is in the description below. We can't wait to see you there. Get ready, get coding, and join the Devtoberfest fun.

[Tom & Rich] Hey, we're here in the Newtown Square area this week, doing some pre-recording for SAP TechEd. How's the experience been for you so far, Rich? I'm not an actor, so it's kind of weird. uh it's been kind of fun though we uh we did some uh social media clips uh playing some uh what would you call them uh almost like uh icebreaker games and a thing and uh we have some funny pictures to go along throughout the day we've been wearing a camera strapped to our body and we're just going to make for some interesting footage while eating a lollipop yeah yeah and coding um i got to wear it on a treadmill so it's been a it's been a wild day We've got some fun stuff coming for you for TechEd. We've got some surprises that we won't reveal, even though we've had them here. But, yeah, so if you haven't signed up for TechEd virtual, that was a great time. No reason to wait for the very end. And if you're planning to join us in Berlin, we look forward to seeing you there. Yep. So any advice for everybody as you get ready for TechEd? Get ready. It's going to be a great show. Yep, I agree. See you all there. Bye-bye.

[Daniel] Devtoberfest has over 80 technical sessions From ABAP to integration to, of course, AI But you know, you can't learn all day You have to have a little fun So we put together a bunch of games, puzzles, and challenges So you can have a little fun And earn thousands and thousands of points Towards the grand prize Week one, we officially release The Scavenger Hunt where you will search through all types of SAP developer resources to find a secret phrase. More on that in a minute. In week two, we release the ever-popular Pettoberfest where you can upload pictures of your pets or any animal that you like. There'll be a little bit of an AI twist to that. Week three, we will release the SAP CryptoCrossword, which has become a tradition, And I'm particularly proud of how it came out this year. We will also have three other puzzles, one on event-based process code jam that we run, another on programming languages, and another one on the developer advocates themselves. And on week four, we will have coders challenges, one for ABAP, one for CAP, and one for SAP Build. Okay, now to the scavenger hunt. Check out my blog for all of the details, including instructions on the 10 missions through all types of SAP developer resources, like the Discovery Center or Help Portal, or even the Developer News. And you will search for one to six hexadecimal digits each time, and by the end of Devtoberfest, you can put them together to find the secret phrase. So now I'm releasing the very first two hexadecimal digits for you to use in the scavenger hunt. In chess, there's a thing called the king's gambit, which is an aggressive opening to sacrifice a pawn to improve the position for white. For that to work, black has to move a specific pawn. his king's pawn, and that pawn is the clue to the hexadecimal digits for today. Any ideas? Subscribe to my blog to be notified of every time we release a new clue for the scavenger hunt. And if you have any questions or difficulties, leave a comment in the blog. Good luck.

[Ajay] Hello, developers. Greetings of the day. I'm very happy to share with you a new enhancement for SAP BTP Cockpit, Favorites and Recents. This feature provides immediate access to important resources from everywhere in the cockpit. This will help you to focus and be more productive while you are working with a multitude of accounts, applications, and services. With a growing number of sub-accounts and service instances and spaces, Favorite and Recent feature greatly simplify the navigation. You can bookmark your most important resources with the favorites, while Recent will show you the resources that you recently worked with. You can even filter on your bookmarks. You also have the possibility to provide your feedback for this new feature and make the experience even better. To learn more about favorites and recents, please read the detailed blog post by Anika. You'll find the link to this blog post in the description.

A few minor deprecation infos, so as always, there's some older UI5 versions that will now be deprecated for the CDNs, so make sure to update. And also deprecated is the analysis path framework, so if you're using the APF, make sure to switch. It's still officially supported, but it's devised to no longer use it. a few other interesting updates so there's now a typed json model so in case you use typescript and the json model definitely check that one out there's a few updates to the odata v4 model as well some other controls receive little updates make sure to check the release notes and something else i saw was that the color of the title and the tool header changed so check it out and test to see what that now looks like and let me know what you think about that in the comments. All right, hope to see you soon. Bye.

entry.title: Success Connect 2025: Gain practical insights for moving from SAP ERP HCM to the cloud
entry.content:
Excitement is in the air as Success Connect is almost upon us. This is my 13th year attending Success Connect and I can honestly say that I look forward to this event every year. Helping our SAP ERP HCM customers migrate their legacy HR systems to the cloud is an important part of my job and something that I am very passionate about. That’s why I’m excited to share with you that this year we will have dedicated track with content specifically designed for our on-premises customers who are looking to move HR to the  cloud.

There’s never been a better moment to rethink how your HR systems support your business. Moving from SAP ERP HCM to the cloud isn’t just a technology upgrade, it’s an opportunity to unlock agility, insights, and smarter ways of working. At Success Connect at SAP Connect 2025, the Move to the cloud with practical insights for SAP ERP HCM customers track is packed with sessions designed to give you the clarity, guidance, and hands-on knowledge needed for a  successful cloud journey.

Why attend this track?

Whether you’re just beginning to explore your options or actively planning your migration, you’ll gain actionable takeaways to ensure a successful cloud transformation, including tools and strategies you can use to plan, execute, and optimize your journey.

This track helps you:

  • Make informed decisions on migration strategies and priorities.
  • Learn from real-world examples to help you reduce risk and drive adoption.
  • Gain best practice guidance from SAP experts.
  • Connect with other organizations navigating similar cloud migration journeys.

Here’s an overview of the content you can expect to see:

Roadmap & Vision

Get a clear view of SAP’s cloud vision, strategy and roadmap for SAP SuccessFactors HCM, including core HR, time, and payroll. Learn about specific enhancements that support industry specific applications in the public sector.

Strategy Talks, Deep Dives & Quick Tips

Learn what you need to know about moving from SAP ERP HCM to SAP SuccessFactors HCM directly from SAP experts. Discover the new Evo Guide, a comprehensive, step-by-step resource for executives, project managers, and decision-makers designed to give you everything you need to know to accelerate your organization’s HR transformation. Explore the SAP Readiness Check tool to learn how to gain rapid insights into your current on-premise system landscape and confidently plan your migration to the cloud.

Customer Success Stories

Hear directly from organizations that have successfully transitioned to SAP SuccessFactors HCM, including AMD, Amtrak, Purdue University and Tenneco. Learn strategies for approaching the project, what worked well, any lessons learned, and the measurable impact realized from moving HR to the cloud.

Meet the experts, demo stations and networking opportunities

Be sure to take advantage of the many opportunities available to you beyond the breakout sessions. Schedule time to meet with our solution experts in a dedicated 1:1 meeting, swing by the demo stations to see our solutions in action and get your questions answered, and network with your peers at the celebration night.  

Don’t wait — secure your spot at Success Connect at SAP Connect 2025 in Las Vegas or the virtual event!  Explore the agenda builder to plan your schedule, and plan your cloud transformation journey. 

I’m looking forward to seeing you all in Las Vegas!

entry.title: Introducing the WalkMe-based alternative in-app help user experience: What and How to Activate
entry.content:
Good news! With the 2508 upgrade, SAP has released 12 standard, non-customizable WalkMe flows, ideal for accountants and sales representatives (no extra license; activation needed). 

SAP recently acquired WalkMe, which is a digital adoption platform that overlays your application to guide users how to navigate workflows step-by-step. Think of it as a tutorial with little bubbles that pop up and tell users where to click and what to input in fields when they're trying to complete a process, like create a sales order. 

Turn this on once and your users get step‑by‑step help in 33 languages* for high‑impact sales and finance tasks: Sales (Find/Edit/Create Order, Set Delivery Block, Add Shipping Instructions), Finance (Find/Change/Reverse/Copy Journal Entry, Customize Line Item View, View Related Documents), plus a homepage tour. These Smart Walk-Thrus are especially helpful to new users who need in-app guidance. Subject to change.

Persona

Embedded Flows

Apps in Scope

 General Accountant

  • Find a Journal Entry
  • Customize Line Item View
  • Change Line Item in a Journal Entry
  • Reverse Journal Entry
  • Copy a Journal Entry
  • View related documents in a Journal Entry

Manage Journal Entries - New Version (F0717A)

 Sales Rep

  • Create a Sales Order
  • Find a Sales Order
  • Edit a Sales Order
  • Set a Delivery Block
  • Add Shipping Instructions

Manage Sales Order - Version 2 (F3893)

 All Personas

  • Welcome to My Home

MyHome

 
*For more information like the available languages, please see SAP Note 3609634.

Note: If you are using SAP Enable Now, the WalkMe-based alternative in-app help user experience or WalkMe Premium is not available.

Activate (2–3 minutes): 

  1. Replace "Shell-home" with "#Shell-startGUI?sap-ui2-tcode=FTG_EXTERNAL" in the URL address to reach the configuration page within your customizing tenant (development/quality). This is a quick shortcut to reach the configuration activity page.
    1. Alternatively, navigate step-by-step to the configuration activity page:
      1. 2SL Customers with SB: Navigate to app "Manage Your Solution" -> Configure Your Solution -> Filter for "Application Area" - Application Platform and Infrastructure"; "Sub Application Area" - "General Settings" -> Basic Settings -> Configuration Steps -> Activate Features -> Configure
      2. 2SL & 3SL Customers with CBC: Navigate to app "Implementation Activities" -> General Settings-> Cross Application -> Activate New Features->Activate Features -> IMG Activity (clock with check symbol)

  2. Select feature: APS_UI_WME_INTEGRATION. Click 'Activate/Deactivate Feature' button near the top.
  3. Create/select transport if prompted. Name Transport to your liking. Close.
  4. Confirm State turns from red to green. Try the flows in dev before exporting to test and prod.

What happens next:

  • Open apps like Manage Journal Entries - New Version or Manage Sales Orders - Version 2 and click the question mark icon at the top of your page to open the WalkMe menu. Click on the Smart Walk Thrus under the Tours tab and you’ll see the bubbles guiding each step.
  • Notify the relevant users (ie. accountants and sales reps) how to find this and use this.

If you're interested in more WalkMe capabilities, like custom flows, analytics, and cross-app functionality (SAP and non-SAP apps), contact your SAP Customer Success Manager to find out more.

Have questions? Let’s chat in the comments!

entry.title: Seeking Practical Approach for Import Shipping & Customs Management in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Dear SAP users,

I hope this message finds you well.

I'm currently supporting a customer who is using SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, and we are facing some challenges around import shipping, customs clearance, and inventory-in-transit tracking.

At the moment, the customer is managing these processes manually using Excel, and we're looking for a way to transition this into SAP to improve control and visibility. However, due to the lack of Global Trade Management (GTM/GTS) capabilities in the Public Cloud, we understand that full automation may not be feasible.

We are exploring alternative approaches and would appreciate any insights on the following:

Best practices for managing import processes (shipping documents, customs clearance info, and in-transit inventory) within the limitations of SAP Public Cloud.

Any known customer cases or reference implementations where similar functionality has been built or approximated — e.g., using custom fields, custom apps, or external system integrations.

For intercompany scenarios:

The customer’s headquarters is running S/4HANA (likely Private Cloud or On-Premise).

They are open to exchanging shipping and customs data via interface (I/F) between the group companies.

We would appreciate your recommendations on how to best handle such data exchange and visibility in the Public Cloud system.

We are aiming for a practical and maintainable solution, even if it involves partial automation or semi-manual processes through custom objects.

Any guidance, documentation, or real-world examples you could provide would be extremely helpful.

Looking forward to your thoughts.

 

Best regards,

Yuna / SAP Consultant

entry.title: Error in an SAP Integration Suite integration
entry.content:
Hello, good afternoon.
We encountered an error when trying to run an integration included in the Mexico Document Compliance Generic package. The problem is that when we add an example XML with fictitious values, we don"t have a PAC configured yet and want to simulate a response and test these integrations.
The error is in the mapping between the input XML and the configured XSD.
The error is the following: com.sap.aii.mappingtool.tf7.IllegalInstanceException: Cannot produce target element /ns3:PACResponse. Queue has not enough values ​​in context. Target XSD requires a value for this element, but target field mapping does not produce one. Probably the XML-instance is not valid for the source XSD, or the target field mapping does not meet the requirement of the target XSD. on the exchange: Exchange[03B9D4CF234F9BE-0000000000000003]

Thank you very much for the support

Regards, Christopher Rivas

entry.title: Re: Free Good Processing (BKA) Scope Item is not working...
entry.content:
Hello @yv4dng2 

This is expected behaviour in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: for scope item BKA – Free Goods Processing, the system does not generate a separate free-goods line. Instead, it applies a 100% discount (condition D100) to the qualifying item. SAP confirms that BKA does not involve “additional item generation.” SAP Support Portal-2822952 - Free Goods Processing does not generate a separate free goods item

Quick checks

Ensure that Free Goods Determination is enabled in your configuration and that your condition record is valid for the specific sales area, material, UoM, and validity dates. SAP Help-free trade 

Maintain/verify records in Manage Free Goods

If you need a separate free line

Use BDA for free delivery with a dedicated order type; this ensures that the line item becomes free via D100 in the pricing procedure. This process generates deliverable items at no cost, with the option of a pro forma or zero invoice.SAP Learning-Understanding Free of Charge Delivery Process

Let me know if it works

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Issues with SAP Practical test module of SAP S/4HANA...
entry.content:
Hello @OlanrewajuBello 

This appears to be the SAP Learning Practice System. When the page remains frozen on task 1, it’s usually a browser, session, pop-up, or cookie issue.

Begin by restarting the practice system via the Practice Systems tile using Resume/Reset, then launch it again from that point.

Use Chrome/Edge Incognito mode and enable pop-ups and third-party cookies for the learning/S4 domains. Some CBC/SSCUIs open in a new pop-up and may be blocked. SAP Support Portal-3251919 - UI5 web browser error appears during configuration in CBC

Perform a hard refresh / clear cache and try again classic Fiori Launchpad troubleshooting SAP Help Portal-SAP Fiori App Cannot Be Opened

If it continues to freeze, submit a ticket to SAP Learning Support via the Learning Help Center → Practice systems support, and include your screenshot, time, and system ID.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Synchronous Goods Receipt
entry.content:
Hello @VickiG1 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Manufacturing Order Type, Integration Scenario with EWM & EWM Synchronous Goods Movement

Yes, you are correct. To enable synchronous Goods Receipt and Goods Issue you only need to update your Order-Type dependent parameters.

Make sure your WM request field is set to No Creation of Transfer Requirements because synchronous posting eliminates the need for separate requests.

You do not need to customise in EWM but make sure your bin mapping and stock type settings are correct. The implications are that inbound deliveries and warehouse tasks are no longer created, postings happen immediately during confirmation and process become faster but are less transparent. Which in place handles errors stricter.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Not able to find API for " SALES QUOTATION SIMULATE"...
entry.content:
Hello @S0027059815 

Thank you for your question.

I recommend looking at Sales Quotations API, Simulate Creation of Sales Order & Sales Quotation for more details.

To summarise, there is no released API for Sales Quotation Simulate in public cloud. You have the option to use the Sales Quotation OData API but this only enables you to create, read, update or delete and not simulate.

I recommend you use the Sales Order Simulate API because it provides simulated pricing, taxed and conditions without persisting the order. You can also pass the same input data you would use for quotation.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Dunning per Mail/Printing only if there is no Mail-Ad...
entry.content:
Hello @FabianSCC 

Thank you for your question.

I recommend looking at Output Management & Configuring Dunning and Outputs for details.

In summary, based on the details you provided, the issue seems not to be with the Exclusive Indicator but with the condition in your second row.

You should keep default email address = is not initial, channel = email, exclusive Indicator = X for the email row. You are required to set default email address = is initial, channel = print.

Without the condition in the second row, the system cannot differentiate and will not print in the fallback case.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAPS4PC -BAdI for Updating Custom Field During PO Cre...
entry.content:
Thank you for your question.

I recommend looking at Extensibility, App Extensibility: Manage Purchase Orders & https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/044700714fc54863b7fa9ea0b5654ba0.html?locale=en-US

To summarise, the MM_PUR_S4_PO_ITEM_MAP is the suitable enhancement spot and it allows you to map custom fields from your source documents such as contract to the PO item. Alternatively, MM_PUR_S4_PO_ITEM can also be used if you need to enrich values in the PO item directly.

You can achieve this by creating your own custom field and enable it for both contract item and PO item. Thereafter, implement the BAdI in CFL and do the necessary mapping. You can test it by creating a PO with reference to a contract.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Print SES - Service Entry Sheets from Purchase Orders
entry.content:
Thank you for your question.

I recommend looking at Service Entry Sheet, S/4HANA Cloud Output Management - Purchase Order & Custom Form Template for more details.

To summarise, service receipts do not have a standard print form delivered like material receipts in public cloud. The message you received appears because you cannot reuse the material receipt output formats directly for ESOA. To enable printing, you will need to:

  • Make use of the Output parameter determination with the service entry sheet category.
  • You can either use a delivered output type for SES or create your won custom form template and assign it to ESOA.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: RAP Behavior extension of Production Order
entry.content:
Hello @swedish23 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at App Extensibility in Production Operations, Extensibility: Production Order Confirmation & RAP On-Stack Developer Extensibility for more details.

To summarise, although the BO is extensible, public cloud does not support all RAP features in behaviour extension.  You received the error because determination on save is not allowed in BO extensions. Public cloud currently supports validations, action and field control.

If you need to influence production order field values, I recommend you use released BadIs. Alternatively, you can also use CFL to enrich values. SAP BTP side-by-side extensibility offers you options for complex defaults, and you can update orders through released APIs.

Best regards

Chris
